summary_points: 1. Ralph Lauren Corporation exceeded expectations for both fourth-quarter and full-year fiscal 2025 revenue, with fourth-quarter revenue up 10% in constant currency and full-year revenue up 8% in constant currency.
2.  For the full fiscal year 2025, operating margins increased by 150 basis points to 14%, exceeding the long-term target.

3. Ralph Lauren provides a preliminary outlook for fiscal 2026, predicting low-single-digit net revenue growth on a constant currency basis and modest operating margin expansion, reflecting caution about the global operating environment.
1. On May 21, 2025, Seagate Technology Holdings plc approved a $5 billion common stock repurchase program with no expiration date.
2.  The company is holding an analyst and investor day on May 22, 2025, to discuss the repurchase program and new financial targets through fiscal year 2028.
3. The timing and amount of future repurchases will depend on Seagate's financial position, results, cash flow, and other factors.
Failed to analyze filing
1. Analog Devices, Inc. reported fiscal second-quarter 2025 revenue of $2.64 billion, a 22% year-over-year increase, exceeding the high end of its guidance.
2.  Trailing twelve-month operating cash flow reached $3.9 billion (39% of revenue), and free cash flow was $3.3 billion (34% of revenue).

3.  The company forecasts $2.75 billion in revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 (ending August 2, 2025), with an expected reported operating margin of approximately 27.2% and adjusted operating margin of approximately 41.5%.
1. Quest Diagnostics Inc. held its 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders on May 15, 2025, where all director nominees were elected and shareholder proposals were voted on.
2.  The advisory resolution to approve executive officer compensation received 85,922,577 votes for and 8,570,674 votes against.
3. A stockholder proposal regarding calling a special meeting of stockholders was not approved, receiving significantly fewer votes for (9,480,355) than against (84,410,956).

1. Align Technology, Inc. held its 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders on May 21, 2025, where stockholders approved an amendment to the 2005 Incentive Plan to increase the number of shares authorized for issuance.

2.  Shareholder votes on proposals ranged widely;  Proposal 6 (allowing stockholders owning 25% of outstanding common stock to call a special meeting) received significantly fewer "For" votes (38,706,293) than "Against" votes (14,717,639).
3. The amended 2005 Incentive Plan, effective May 21, 2025, increases the maximum number of shares that may be awarded and sold under the plan to 34,668,895.
1. Crown Castle Inc. eliminated all supermajority voting requirements and certain outdated provisions from its Restated Certificate of Incorporation, effective May 21, 2025.
2. At the May 21, 2025 annual meeting, the advisory vote to approve named executive officer compensation received 346,381,062 votes for and 26,151,894 votes against.
3.  The Amended and Restated Certificate of Incorporation includes extensive restrictions on share ownership to maintain REIT tax status.

1. On May 21, 2025, Diamondback Energy, Inc. held its 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, resulting in a leadership transition with Travis D. Stice becoming Executive Chairman and Kaes Van’t Hof becoming Chief Executive Officer.
2.  Shareholder votes on Proposal 4, regarding executive severance arrangements, resulted in 205,457,636 votes against and only 55,652,005 votes in favor.
3.  David L. Houston retired from his position as a director, effective May 21, 2025.
1. Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. declared a $0.23 per share quarterly dividend, payable July 11, 2025.
2. As of May 21, 2025, Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. reported annual revenue exceeding $15 billion.
3.  An 8-K filing was submitted to the SEC on May 21, 2025.
1. Crown Castle Inc. declared a quarterly dividend of $1.0625 per share payable on June 30, 2025, to stockholders of record at the close of business on June 13, 2025.
2.  As of May 21, 2025, Crown Castle Inc. owns and leases over 40,000 cell towers and approximately 90,000 route miles of fiber.
3. Future dividends are subject to the approval of Crown Castle's Board of Directors.
1. Andrew Witty resigned from his position as a director of UnitedHealth Group Incorporated, effective May 20, 2025.
2.  This 8-K filing, dated May 21, 2025, reports the immediate resignation of a director, and that he will not stand for re-election at the annual shareholder meeting on June 2, 2025.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are mentioned beyond the director's resignation.
1. At FirstEnergy Corp.'s May 21, 2025, annual shareholder meeting, all board nominees were elected, though several received significant "against" votes ranging from 6,613,165 to 16,575,405.
2.  Shareholder proposal regarding a report on lobbying activities and policies failed to receive approval, garnering only 38,583,584 votes in favor versus 439,112,618 against.
3. PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP was ratified as the company's independent registered public accounting firm for the 2025 fiscal year, receiving 505,600,965 votes in favor.

1. Targa Resources Corp.'s 2025 Annual Meeting on May 20, 2025, resulted in the election of four Class III directors (Waters S. Davis IV, Rene R. Joyce, Caron A. Lawhorn, and Matthew J. Meloy) for three-year terms expiring in 2028, ratification of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as independent auditors for 2025, and advisory approval of named executive officer compensation for fiscal year 2024.

2.  Significant shareholder dissent was observed in the director elections, with votes against ranging from 1.4 million to 23.8 million shares out of approximately 180 million votes cast for each nominee.
3. The advisory vote on executive compensation had approximately 10.3 million votes against, indicating a level of shareholder concern regarding executive pay packages as of December 31, 2024.
1.  On May 16, 2025, Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. held its annual stockholder meeting, where shareholders elected ten directors to serve one-year terms.
2.  The advisory resolution on executive compensation was approved by stockholders with 457,032,009 votes for and 27,860,556 votes against.
3. Stockholders approved amendments to the company's Certificate of Incorporation to implement voting limitations for regulatory compliance, with 487,751,664 votes for and 214,016 votes against.
1. Mosaic Co. amended and restated its credit agreement on May 16, 2025, extending the maturity date of its $2.5 billion credit facility from August 19, 2026, to May 16, 2030.
2.  The amended agreement reduces rates on unused commitment fees and provides Mosaic with more flexibility under restrictive covenants.
3. The amendment provides Mosaic with a longer-term credit facility until May 16, 2030, reducing financial risk associated with refinancing in the near term.
1. On May 19, 2025, FMC Corp issued $750,000,000 of 8.450% Fixed-to-Fixed Reset Rate Subordinated Notes due 2055, with the closing expected on May 27, 2025.
2. The net proceeds from the note sale are expected to be approximately $741 million.
3. The underwriting agreement contains representations, warranties, conditions, and covenants, including indemnification and contribution provisions for certain liabilities.

1. Phillips 66's 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareholders resulted in the election of two Phillips 66 nominees (Robert W. Pease and Nigel Hearne) and two Elliott Management nominees (Sigmund L. Cornelius and Michael A. Heim), while John E. Lowe and Howard Ungerleider were not re-elected.

2. The shareholder vote to declassify the Board of Directors did not receive the required 80% affirmative vote, despite significant support, while Elliott’s proposal for annual director resignations was overwhelmingly rejected.
3.  Based on the preliminary results (as of May 21, 2025), the Board recognizes shareholder preference for annual elections and remains committed to declassification in the future.

1. On May 21, 2025, American Tower Corporation priced a €500.0 million (approximately $562.0 million) registered public offering of senior unsecured notes due 2032, with a 3.625% annual interest rate and issued at 99.994% of face value.
2.  The net proceeds of €496.8 million (approximately $558.4 million) will be used to repay existing indebtedness and for general corporate purposes.
3. American Tower intends to use the net proceeds to partially repay its $6.0 billion senior unsecured multicurrency revolving credit facility.
1. Zoetis Inc. declared a $0.50 per share dividend for the third quarter of 2025, payable on September 3, 2025, to shareholders of record as of July 18, 2025.
2. Zoetis reported $9.3 billion in revenue for 2024, with approximately 13,800 employees.
3.  The filing contains forward-looking statements regarding business plans and future financial performance, subject to various risks and uncertainties detailed in their 10-K and 10-Q filings.

1. On May 19, 2025, Consolidated Edison Inc. held its annual meeting, where shareholders voted to elect the board of directors, ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as independent accountants, and provide an advisory vote on named executive officer compensation.

2.  Significant opposition was registered against the election of several board members, with "against" votes ranging from 1.86 million (Dwight A. McBride) to 21.9 million (John F. Killian),  out of approximately 268 million total votes cast (excluding broker non-votes).
3.  The advisory vote on executive compensation resulted in 222 million shares voted "for" and 17.3 million shares voted "against," with 1.5 million abstentions and 51.6 million broker non-votes.
